text: <extra_id_0> ZAP-70 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> tyrosine kinase , <extra_id_0> CD45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and T cell receptor involvement in UV - and H2O2 - induced T cell signal transduction .
Several mammalian responses to UV irradiation , including the activation of NF-kappa B , are believed to involve tyrosine phosphorylation .
UV irradiation and H2O2 treatment of T lymphocytes induce protein tyrosine phosphorylation and Ca2+ signals similar to those observed following biological stimulation .
We have examined the role of cell surface molecules in these responses .
Normal T lymphocytes whose surface expression of CD3 was depleted showed impaired UV - induced tyrosine phosphorylation and Ca2+ signals .
Similarly , Jurkat T cell lines deficient in CD3 or <extra_id_0> CD45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression also gave impaired UV responses .

text: However , all these cell types still gave strong Ca2+ and tyrosine phosphorylation responses to H2O2 .
The T cell tyrosine kinase <extra_id_0> ZAP-70 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was found to be highly responsive to UV and H2O2 treatment .

<extra_id_0> ZAP-70 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> responsiveness to UV required expression of both CD3 and <extra_id_0> CD45 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whereas only CD3 was required for the response to H2O2 .

text: UV - induced activation of NF-kappa B was blocked by CD3 depletion , indicating the importance of such cell surface molecules in biological responses to UV .
In nonlymphoid cells , the <extra_id_0> epidermal growth factor receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> displayed increased tyrosine phosphorylation within seconds of UV irradiation .

text: These results suggest that UV - induced signal transduction is mediated via cell surface receptors that normally respond to biological stimulation , whereas H2O2 is able to partially bypass this requirement .
